body: Doing more research this might be a data type issue. I found [this SO post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26552116/contract-of-pandas-dataframe-equals) on a similar issue.

So these have different dtypes, so they are not equal. `==` _may_ work, but if things are typed as `object` this will be completely non-performant. (and `==` will not work for things that sometimes 'look' equal but are not actually, e.g. a float and integer will compare equal but are not the same).

```
In [5]: df1.dtypes
Out[5]: 
year               int64
month              int64
day                int64
hour               int64
minute             int64
sec              float64
latd               int64
latc              object
lond               int64
lonc              object
ampmag           float64
numphases          int64
azgap              int64
stadist            int64
rms              float64
peazimuth          int64
pedip              int64
perror           float64
ieazimuth          int64
```

```
In [6]: df2.dtypes
Out[6]: 
year             object
month            object
day              object
hour             object
minute           object
sec              object
latd             object
latc             object
lond             object
lonc             object
ampmag           object
numphases        object
azgap            object
stadist          object
rms              object
peazimuth        object
pedip            object
```
